item.description: Slides View lectures slide in your browser (html) Action Items Note that Assignment 1 is made available today. Please make sure you have sent us your gmail account at email Points of reflection Your devices contain an incredible amount of personal information. The consequences from misuse by malicious individuals for some of this information are quite easy to see (eg credit card numbers). item.title: Bioinformatics repositories: the NCBI and other tools
item.description: Required The NCBI Handbook Please read short chapter on Genome (page 89-94). Also please read the definition of GenBank (page 381). This link gives a bit more information. Please read The Entrez Search and Retrieval System (page 459-44). Then try it out using your favourite gene (choose an organism and gene at random otherwise). Finally please read the short section on the NCBI Protein database (page 385-6)

Enumerate all the undirected graphs with 6 species. Suppose you have an amino acid sequence of length 100. You apply the PAM_1 Markov model to each position. So some amino acids change, likely most don’t.

item.title: Overview
item.description: Course objectives Our fundamental goal is to ensure you have the necessary bioinformatics skills, both in terms of tools and underlying analytic approaches,in order to fully participate in modern life science approaches. Biology is becoming increasingly quantitative.⊕Instructor Mike Hallett GE120.07 Office TuTh 12-13 hallett.mike.t@gmail.com @hallettmichael Course TuTh September 8–December 7, 2021 13:15-14:30 Zoom Slack Github repo Lectures RStudio Cloud Labs TBA TBA
